item.description:
This is the seventh session of our HAC group, in which we work through a readable guide to the bizarre logic and historical inaccuracy of the Hebrew Bible.

Please read the following sections from our series reference How to Read the Bible: A Guide to Scripture, Then and Now, by James L. Kugel.

  • Chapter 22. Joshua and the Conquest of Canaan, pages 365-385
  • Chapter 23. Judges and Chiefs, pages 386-416

And read the following:

  • The Wikipedia article on Joshua.
  • The Wikipedia article on Jericho: Biblical References.
  • The Wikipedia article on Judges.
  • The Wikipedia article on Deborah.
  • The Wikipedia article on Book of Ruth.
  • The Wikipedia article on Women in the Bible: Hebrew Bible (Old Testament).
  • The Issue of U.S. News and World Report on Women in the Bible. Read the Introduction and the articles relating to the Old Testament: Women of the Bible


In addition to discussing the reading materials, we will be watching another 15-minute video segment related to the Bible by noted Egyptologist John Romer.

Please catch up with the readings from the earlier sessions. You'll get more out of the group if you're aware of Kugel's approach to the source material.

For more information, see http://www.cthumanist...
